ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend a Kant course, but not one taught by this teacher.
A detailed look the philosophical arguments of Kant's Critique of Pure Reason.

I would tell another student that this is a comprehensive and rigorous course on the most important text in the philosophical canon. If you want to understand that text, you should take Pogge's course. However, the level of the material is so high and the ideas are so difficult, that I would not recommend this course to students that are not extremely gifted or in graduate studies in philosophy.

Yes. I would recommend this course to any student looking for a thorough introduction to Kant's first Critique. However, for a more basic introduction to Kant, I would recommend an undergraduate course instead. Very thorough.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Understanding Kant is essential to a student of political philosophy. This course helped me in that project a great deal.
This course put me on track to understanding Kant. That is huge. It will also be key to my own dissertation research.
